required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Suspension Training on the Balance of Healthy Young Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Influencia Del Entrenamiento en suspensión en el Equilibrio de Adultos jóvenes Sanos

brief_summary.textblock: Non-specific training through the use of devices in which the subject can be suspended is a technique that has aroused a growing interest in recent years. One of its advantages may be to enhance the balance, since it induces a high level of neuromuscular stimulation. Indeed, a suspension training suppose a high demand of the core musculature, require a high degree of postural control, precise response strategies , anticipatory capacity and muscular conditioning. However, current literature targeting healthy young adults and appraising the specifics effects of suspension training on balance is scarce or non-existent to the best of our knowledge. For this reason this interventional study will primarily assess the effects of suspension training on different balance components.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to four weeks

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to four weeks
secondary_outcome.description: A timed test for static-dynamic balance assessment, the participant stands on one leg over a foam with closed eyes

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to four weeks
Change from baseline to four weeks
secondary_outcome.description: A measure to assess motor coordination under time pressure

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to four weeks
other_outcome.description: This is generally used to assess the functional strength of the lower extremities, the transition movements, the balance and the risk of falls are evaluated

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to four weeks
other_outcome.description: This is used to assess core strength

intervention.description: Nine sessions of suspension training The suspension device will be TRX (R) The intervention will be administered in work:rest intervals (2:1) A global training approach will seek to train lower limbs, upper body and core musculature

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy young adults aged between 18 and 30
Exclusion Criteria:
- Professional athlete
- Musculoskeletal injury in the last 6 months (i.e. sprain, bone fracture)
- Known balance disorders including vertigo, central or vestibular limitations
